content:
• Wednesday, May 29, 2013
  • DISH

    Dish (NASDAQ:DISH) raises its offer for Clearwire (CLWR) to $4.40/share in cash, easily trumping...

    Dish (NASDAQ:DISH) raises its offer for Clearwire (CLWR) to $4.40/share in cash, easily trumping Sprint's (NYSE:S) revised $3.40/share bid. Clearwire +21.6% AH to $4.23. The 4G carrier's minority shareholders are set to vote on Sprint's offer on Friday.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:56 PM | 3 Comments
  • UNXL

    UniPixel (UNXL -7.9%) fell hard again today in the absence of major news. Though shares are...

    UniPixel (UNXL -7.9%) fell hard again today in the absence of major news. Though shares are still up 42% YTD and over 3x from a year ago, they're now down 53% from their April 17 high. Yesterday, Feltl's Jeffrey Schreiner reported rival metal mesh touch sensor developer Atmel (NASDAQ:ATML) sees Fujifilm as a "much more significant competitor" than UniPixel. Atmel management told Schreiner the company expects to qualify its Colorado facility for XSense production by the end of May, but that delays have led it to put orders from tier 2/3 clients on hold. Cowen argued last week UniPixel's UniBoss sensors have variable cost and throughput advantages over rivals.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:59 PM | 12 Comments
  • NVE

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: NVE +23.9%. IQNT +6.4%. AVGO +3.9%. HIMX +3.9%. ELN...

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: NVE +23.9%. IQNT +6.4%. AVGO +3.9%. HIMX +3.9%. ELN +2.7%.
    After-hours top losers: UCO -9.1%. BWP -4.4%. IOC -4.1%. VNR -4.0%. NBN -2.4%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:54 PM | 2 Comments
  • HNH

    Handy & Harman (NASDAQ:HNH) approves a $2M stock buyback. The repurchase program is expected...

    Handy & Harman (NASDAQ:HNH) approves a $2M stock buyback. The repurchase program is expected to continue through the end of the current fiscal year unless extended or shortened by the Board. Shares -1.2% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:35 PM
  • TLYS

    More on Tilly's (NYSE:TLYS): CFO Bill Langsdorf plans to retire later this year. Mr. Langsdorf...

    More on Tilly's (NYSE:TLYS): CFO Bill Langsdorf plans to retire later this year. Mr. Langsdorf has held the role for about six years, and will remain on until his successor is in place to ensure a smooth transition. Shares +2% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:16 PM
  • TLYS

    More on Tilly's (NYSE:TLYS) Q1 beat: Relatively strong March/April comps fuel better than...

    More on Tilly's (NYSE:TLYS) Q1 beat: Relatively strong March/April comps fuel better than expected results. Overall, comps growth comes in at 1.1% Y/Y while e-commerce sales rise 16%. Outlook: Management sees FQ2 EPS of $0.11-$0.14/share as a fiscal year calendar shift will result in "the first peak week of the back-to-school season … fall[ing] in the end of Q2." For FY13 the company sees EPS of $0.76-0.82/share versus consensus of $0.81. Shares +2% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:09 PM
  • RCL

    Royal Caribbean (NYSE:RCL) estimates the direct financial impact of the Grandeur of the Seas...

    Royal Caribbean (NYSE:RCL) estimates the direct financial impact of the Grandeur of the Seas fire, net of insurance, will be a hefty $0.10 per share. The company has taken the vessel out of service and expects it will take approximately six weeks to complete repair efforts, which led to the higher impact on earnings due to the fact that the affected sailings were during the premium summer season. Shares -0.9% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:55 PM
  • VNR

    Vanguard Natural Resources (NYSE:VNR) -4.4% AH after announcing a public offering of 7M common...

    Vanguard Natural Resources (NYSE:VNR) -4.4% AH after announcing a public offering of 7M common units. VNR intends to use net proceeds to repay part of its indebtedness outstanding under its senior secured revolving credit facility.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:40 PM | 1 Comment
  • BWP

    Boardwalk Pipeline Partners (NYSE:BWP) -4.6% AH after announcing a public offering of 11M common...

    Boardwalk Pipeline Partners (NYSE:BWP) -4.6% AH after announcing a public offering of 11M common units. BWP expects to use net proceeds to pay down debt and possibly for other purposes such as funding capital expenditures for growth projects.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:35 PM
  • NVE

    NV Energy (NYSE:NVE) +22.4% AH after agreeing to be acquired by Berkshire Hathaway (BRK.A,...

    NV Energy (NYSE:NVE) +22.4% AH after agreeing to be acquired by Berkshire Hathaway (BRK.A, BRK.B) subsidiary MidAmerican Energy for $23.75/share, a 23.2% premium to today's closing price. Upon completion of the deal, MidAmerican will have assets of ~$66B and its regulated electric and gas utilities will serve 8.4M customers.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:28 PM | 3 Comments
  • AA

    Alcoa (NYSE:AA) responds to Moody's downgrade, saying that it believes the cut to be more of a...

    Alcoa (NYSE:AA) responds to Moody's downgrade, saying that it believes the cut to be more of a reflection of overall macroeconomic conditions and the volatility of metal prices, rather than a true statement of the financial and operating strength of AA. The company notes that its balance sheet and liquidity position are both strong, with limited near-term bond maturities. Shares -1% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:23 PM | 2 Comments
  • AVGO

    Avago Tech (NASDAQ:AVGO): FQ2 EPS of $0.61 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $562M (-3% Y/Y) beats by...

    Avago Tech (NASDAQ:AVGO): FQ2 EPS of $0.61 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $562M (-3% Y/Y) beats by $3.76M. Shares +2% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:10 PM
  • FB

    S&P's Scott Kessler goes contrarian on Facebook (FB -3.4%), upgrading shares to Buy in...

    S&P's Scott Kessler goes contrarian on Facebook (FB -3.4%), upgrading shares to Buy in response to their May swoon. Kessler touts Facebook's "strong market position, mobile momentum, significant growth, and considerable balance-sheet flexibility." Meanwhile, Facebook is borrowing a line from Twitter and giving major public figures the chance to create Verified Pages.  Hashtags, another Twitter staple, are reportedly on tap. (earlier: I, II)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:04 PM | 6 Comments
  • CLF

    Concerns about cyclicality spark an investor exodus from Cliffs Natural Resources (CLF -5.8%),...

    Concerns about cyclicality spark an investor exodus from Cliffs Natural Resources (CLF -5.8%), whose performance is heavily influenced by macroeconomic changes. Today, the OECD cut its global growth forecast, BHP says it's not expanding its mining operations, and of course uncertainty lingers over how long the Fed will continue its stimulus measures.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:58 PM
  • SCHN

    DA Davidson's weighs in on Schnitzer Steel (SCHN -2.9%), saying it wasn't surprised by the...

    DA Davidson's weighs in on Schnitzer Steel (SCHN -2.9%), saying it wasn't surprised by the downbeat tempo of today's earnings guidance. As a result of what it sees as a soft market and tight supply, it's dropping H2 estimates and its price target to $32 from $36.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:33 PM
  • DNR

    Denbury Resources (DNR +1.9%) is upgraded to Outperform from Neutral with a $24 price target (up...

    Denbury Resources (DNR +1.9%) is upgraded to Outperform from Neutral with a $24 price target (up from $20) at Credit Suisse, which says DNR's contemplated strategy shift from a growth focus to a balanced growth and income model, with a meaningful dividend component through an upstream MLP structure, would be a "seminal event" for the stock.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:26 PM
  • AGNC

    Some green creeps into the mortgage REIT sector (MORT) after a panicky morning. Sector giants...

    Some green creeps into the mortgage REIT sector (MORT) after a panicky morning. Sector giants AGNC and NLY post small gains, while hybrid Invesco (IVR +2.8%) and agency adjustable-rate player Hatteras (HTS +3.1%) have moved strongly higher. Not only did insiders step in to buy plunging Armour Residential today, but they were also buyers (I, II) of sister-company Javelin Mortgage (JMI -2.3%) which got hit with a downgrade to Hold at Citigroup. At the morning's low of $14.69, the stock was trading at a 20% discount to March 31 book value.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:20 PM | 6 Comments
  • YORW

    The York Water Company (YORW -2.7%) slips after announcing earlier today that it's asking the...

    The York Water Company (YORW -2.7%) slips after announcing earlier today that it's asking the Pennsylvania Public Utility Commission for an increase in water rates. The utility says it's seeking a $7.1M increase in annual water revenues, as well as a $27,960 increase in annual wastewater revenues for the Asbury Pointe Subdivision.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:17 PM
  • XEL

    Xcel Energy (XEL -2.3%) slips with other interest-rate sensitive issues today, despite...

    Xcel Energy (XEL -2.3%) slips with other interest-rate sensitive issues today, despite reaffirming FY13 earnings guidance of $1.85 - $1.95 per diluted share late yesterday, bracketing Street estimates of $1.90.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:00 PM
  • LPRI

    Lone Pine Resources (LPR -17.9%) sinks to a 52-week low after it receives a continued listing...

    Lone Pine Resources (LPR -17.9%) sinks to a 52-week low after it receives a continued listing standards notice from the NYSE, Moody's downgrades its corporate credit citing a likely covenant breach and a fully drawn credit facility, and Wells Fargo cuts shares to Underperform, saying LPR's asset value is eclipsed by an over-leveraged balance sheet.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:47 PM | 4 Comments
  • DSW

    DSW +4.59% is among the day's winners after posting top and bottom line results for Q1 that beat...

    DSW +4.59% is among the day's winners after posting top and bottom line results for Q1 that beat estimates. CEO Mike MacDonald says the company's merchandising and supply chain teams "demonstrated remarkable execution flexibility," helping the company counter "unprecedented swings in weather patterns" during the period. DSW raised its dividend and guided for "flat to 2%" comps growth in FY13 and adjusted EPS of $3.40-3.60 versus consensus of $3.49. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 2:42 PM
  • CNL

    Small and mid-cap regulated utilities with high dividend yields are trading slightly lower as...

    Small and mid-cap regulated utilities with high dividend yields are trading slightly lower as investors rotate positions on rising treasury yields: CNL -1.7%, EE -2.1%, GXP -1.7%, PNW -2.4%, POR -2.5%, SCG -1.9%, NVE -2.8%, WEC -2.5%, WR -2.6%, AWK -1.7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:41 PM
  • MITK

    Mitek Systems (MITK +8.6%) rises after saying the U.S. Patent Office has issued the company a...

    Mitek Systems (MITK +8.6%) rises after saying the U.S. Patent Office has issued the company a patent covering a "process for measuring signature simplicity, and using it to detect fraud." (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:31 PM
  • PFE

    Pfizer (PFE -2%) says that UPM Pharmaceuticals, a Baltimore-based drug development and contract...

    Pfizer (PFE -2%) says that UPM Pharmaceuticals, a Baltimore-based drug development and contract manufacturer, has acquired the 500K square-foot commercial manufacturing facility that PFE currently operates in Bristol, Tenn. The new facility gives UPM the capability to annually produce 3.5B tablets and 680M capsules. As part of the purchase, UPM will continue to manufacture PFE's current portfolio of products within the facility for two years.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:18 PM
  • ALVR

    Alvarion (ALVR -12.7%) craters midday after announcing it will raise $2.9M in two private...

    Alvarion (ALVR -12.7%) craters midday after announcing it will raise $2.9M in two private placements which together call for the "issuance of ordinary shares equal to … ~18.5% of ALVR's outstanding share capital." Warrants will be issued for the purchase of an additional 4%. Moreover, the company says "the agreements … provide for the potential issuance of additional shares pursuant to certain price adjustment mechanisms." (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:06 PM | 1 Comment
  • FNMA

    Bruce Berkowitz has taken about a $500M stake in the preferred stock of Fannie Mae (OTCQB:FNMA...

    Bruce Berkowitz has taken about a $500M stake in the preferred stock of Fannie Mae (OTCQB:FNMA -23%) and Freddie Mac (OTCQB:FMCC -23.2%) - please note the symbols here are for the common. "The time to restructure (Frannie) is upon us," he tells CNBC. "Taxpayer dollars ... will be fully repaid ... and equitable treatment of taxpaying shareholders, including community banks and insurance companies must be restored." The common stock has rebounded somewhat from an early plunge, and the preferred shares have turned higher.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:02 PM | 2 Comments
  • ENOC

    The rationale behind Raymond James' upgrade of EnerNOC (ENOC -3.5%) which came earlier today...

    The rationale behind Raymond James' upgrade of EnerNOC (ENOC -3.5%) which came earlier today amid heavy selling pressure: A generalized overreaction to disappointing PJM auction clearing prices, a high free cash flow yield relative to peers, the possibility of M&A, and the likelihood of continued quarterly earnings beats.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:49 PM
  • F

    Though shares of Ford (F +2.6%) stand at 52-week highs, a growing number of investors think the...

    Though shares of Ford (F +2.6%) stand at 52-week highs, a growing number of investors think the market is valuating the company on the conservative side. They think the only thing holding back the stock is concern over the automaker's losses over Europe, but they note the protracted auto slump on the continent appears to have finally bottomed out. By the numbers, a forward P/E ratio of 6.5 and a yield of 2.55% make Ford a tempting buy.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:47 PM
  • VECO

    Veeco (VECO +3.3%) rallies after UBS raises its estimates and PT, citing expansion plans from...

    Veeco (VECO +3.3%) rallies after UBS raises its estimates and PT, citing expansion plans from the company's top Chinese customer. The report might also be giving a lift to LED wafer vendor Rubicon (RBCN +3.3%). Veeco and rival Aixtron (AIXG -1.2%) sold off last month on a report the companies have drastically cut prices for LED manufacturing gear due to Chinese competition. Shares sold off more moderately in early May on a report the Shenzhen, China government is ending an LED manufacturing incentive plan.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:41 PM | 1 Comment
  • VZ

    U.S. telcos are having a rough day. A general selloff in high-yield stocks could be a factor,...

    U.S. telcos are having a rough day. A general selloff in high-yield stocks could be a factor, but not all of the decliners pay huge dividends (if any). VZ -2.9%. WIN -2.7%. CTL -2.4%. CBB -2.5%. CBEY -4.7%. TWTC -2.1%. TDS -2.6%. SHEN -7.4%. Volatile Latin American carrier NII Holdings (NIHD -7.2%) is also selling off.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:28 PM | 5 Comments
  • CAL

    Brown Shoe Co. (BWS +12.1%) is a winner today after reporting Q1 earnings that beat estimates....

    Brown Shoe Co. (BWS +12.1%) is a winner today after reporting Q1 earnings that beat estimates. From the report: Gross margin expands 160 basis points Y/Y and adjusted EPS rises 37.7%. Comps growth comes in at +1.1% for the period (+14.2% in April, after "uncooperative weather" dissipated). The company raises its FY13 EPS guidance to $1.22-1.29 versus consensus of $1.23. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 1:23 PM
  • UNFI

    Another price target hike (previous) for United Natural Foods (UNFI -3.8%), this time from Piper...

    Another price target hike (previous) for United Natural Foods (UNFI -3.8%), this time from Piper Jaffray (Neutral, $57 from $49). Like Goldman's Stephen Grambling, analyst Sean Naughton is "encouraged by the "raised top line guidance" and category trends, but does say the "risk/reward on [the] shares is balanced at current levels."

     
     
     
     
    | 1:14 PM
  • SPPI

    Spectrum Pharmaceuticals (SPPI -3.5%) shakes off early gains to trade lower today, despite being...

    Spectrum Pharmaceuticals (SPPI -3.5%) shakes off early gains to trade lower today, despite being initiated at Burrill Institutional Research with a Market Outperform and a price target of $12 a share. It's a puzzling call, in that the analyst appears to be seeing some things that the rest of the Street doesn't. Regardless, the target price target Burrill set only puts the stock back in the same territory it held in March of this year, when it collapsed after the company forecast FY13 earnings well below Street estimates.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:14 PM | 1 Comment
  • RAX

    Rackspace's (RAX -3.8%) 2013 woes continue after Canaccord declares "downside risks remain"...

    Rackspace's (RAX -3.8%) 2013 woes continue after Canaccord declares "downside risks remain" given heightened competition, aggressive pricing from rivals, and the "operating distraction" caused by Rackspace's transition to OpenStack. Shares -49% YTD after getting crushed earlier this month in the wake of a Q1 revenue miss.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:12 PM
  • ARTX

    Arotech (ARTX +25%) spikes to new 52-week highs on heavy volume with no significant news-related...

    Arotech (ARTX +25%) spikes to new 52-week highs on heavy volume with no significant news-related catalyst.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:02 PM
  • DOLE

    "Too many, too few, who cares? It's a strawberry problem," Joe Terranova said yesterday on CNBC,...

    "Too many, too few, who cares? It's a strawberry problem," Joe Terranova said yesterday on CNBC, referencing Dole Food's (DOLE -3.8%) Tuesday announcement regarding strawberry business losses, share buyback cancellations, and ship purchases. Today, Goldman lowers its price target on the shares to $10.50 (which would be an improvement from current levels) from $11, citing the news. The shares are off ~9% this week.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:00 PM
  • MO

    Tobacco stocks trade lower as higher Treasury yields are taking just a bit of the shine off the...

    Tobacco stocks trade lower as higher Treasury yields are taking just a bit of the shine off the group as a good dividend income play. Decliners: Altra (NYSE:MO) -2.1%, Reynold American (NYSE:RAI) -2.2%, Lorillard (NYSE:LO) -2%; Vector Group (NYSE:VGR) -1.7%, Philip Morris (MO) -1.8%, British American Tobacco -2.3%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:46 PM | 5 Comments
  • STEI

    Midday top 10 gainers: STEI +34%. SFD +25%. VRTB +22%. CLSN +19%. ARTX +19%. BWS +14%. CLNT...

    Midday top 10 gainers: STEI +34%. SFD +25%. VRTB +22%. CLSN +19%. ARTX +19%. BWS +14%. CLNT +12%. PWRD +12%. AEGR +12%. TFM +10%.
    Midday top 10 Losers: OWW -14%. MRC -13%. ALVR -12%. SOCB -11%. TSL -11%. PIP -11%. OTC:PRXI -12%. VIMC -11%. WHX -10%. TISA -9%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:45 PM
  • NVLN

    JPMorgan joins Canaccord in its Aegerion Pharmaceuticals (AEGR +12%) lovefest today, bumping its...

    JPMorgan joins Canaccord in its Aegerion Pharmaceuticals (AEGR +12%) lovefest today, bumping its price target higher for the stock by $21 to $69. The firm cites upbeat discussions with doctors about Juxtapid, who say that they are impressed with the drug's efficacy and don't expect tolerablility to be a major issue. They also add that frequent liver monitoring is not overly burdensome and doesn't slow new patient adds, and referrals are accelerating.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:45 PM | 1 Comment
  • CYBX

    Canaccord reiterates its Buy recommendation on Cyberonics (CYBX -1.9%), saying the fundamental...

    Canaccord reiterates its Buy recommendation on Cyberonics (CYBX -1.9%), saying the fundamental business "remains intact" after the company's reconsideration request for VNS Therapy was denied by the Centers for Medicare and Medicaid (price target lowered to $49 from $59).

     
     
     
     
    | 11:42 AM
  • FNMA

    Fannie Mae (OTCQB:FNMA -33.8%) and Freddie Mac (OTCQB:FMCC -37.6%) both crumble - perhaps under...

    Fannie Mae (OTCQB:FNMA -33.8%) and Freddie Mac (OTCQB:FMCC -37.6%) both crumble - perhaps under their own ridiculous weight, or maybe given a push by SA's Dividend Monkey. He points out the two businesses - technically with intrinsic value of zero - were being valued (as of last night's close) at 40-60% of their 2007 market caps. The music's stopped - time to find a chair.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:40 AM | 13 Comments
  • PT-OLD

    Portugal Telecom (PT-OLD -2.8%) slumps in response to a downgrade to Hold from Berenberg. The...

    Portugal Telecom (PT-OLD -2.8%) slumps in response to a downgrade to Hold from Berenberg. The downgrade comes shortly after the Portuguese/Brazilian carrier reported a 9.5% Y/Y revenue drop for Q1, as wireline sub losses and price pressure offset broadband/pay-TV growth. Goldman upgraded PT to Conviction Buy last month.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:37 AM
  • NPSP

    NPS Pharmaceuticals (NPSP -1.9%) slips after the drug-maker prices its 6.9M share offering at...

    NPS Pharmaceuticals (NPSP -1.9%) slips after the drug-maker prices its 6.9M share offering at $14.53, about an 8% discount to yesterday's close. Underwriters exercised options to purchase an additional 900K shares to cover overallotments. The sale generated around $93.4M in net proceeds, but NPSP didn't specify how it plans to spend the new funding.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:35 AM
  • TSLA

    Tesla Motors (TSLA -6.5%) trips up a circuit breaker as it falls quickly in morning trading....

    Tesla Motors (TSLA -6.5%) trips up a circuit breaker as it falls quickly in morning trading. Over 14M TSLA shares have already traded hands today with the juicy Tesla news for the day still to come. It appears at least a few people are listening to SA contributor Ashraf Eassa who advised shareholders to take some profits off the table.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:32 AM | 12 Comments
  • MRC

    MRC Global (MRC -12.7%) discloses that its line pipe sales during April-May would total ~$100M...

    MRC Global (MRC -12.7%) discloses that its line pipe sales during April-May would total ~$100M below its previous expectations, explaining that its major U.S. customers have spent less on line pipe in recent weeks due to reduced drilling activity and lower natural gas liquid prices. MRC also says it has been hurt by longer waits for permits for crude oil pipelines.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:24 AM
  • ATVI

    Activision's (ATVI -3%) Blizzard unit has "decided to push the reset button" on its next big...

    Activision's (ATVI -3%) Blizzard unit has "decided to push the reset button" on its next big multiplayer online game, VentureBeat reports. The still-unnamed title (its codename is Titan), in development for years, now isn't expected to launch until 2016 "at the earliest," and its developer team has been cut from 100 to 30. News of the delay comes shortly after Activision reported its World of Warcraft sub base fell by 1.3M in the March quarter to 8.3M. VentureBeat notes Blizzard "often cancels projects that have been in the works for years, if it believes that those games don’t meet its quality bar."

     
     
     
     
    | 11:21 AM | 1 Comment
  • CYBX

    Cyberonics (CYBX -2.4%) falls after saying the Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services will...

    Cyberonics (CYBX -2.4%) falls after saying the Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services will not reconsider a decision to deny coverage for the company's VNS Therapy in patients with treatment-resistant depression. CEO Dan Moore is "very disappointed in the decision." (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:14 AM | 1 Comment
  • WHX

    Galbraith Investment Management issues a warning to investors of Whiting USA Trust (WHX -8.9%),...

    Galbraith Investment Management issues a warning to investors of Whiting USA Trust (WHX -8.9%), believing the market continues to fail to recognize that WHX expects to make only eight more quarterly distributions and will terminate in August 2015 with no residual value. Galbraith believes WHX is overvalued and investors holding a long position will lose a substantial portion of their investment.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:12 AM
  • IAC

    InterActiveCorp (IACI -2.5%) is trying to find a buyer for Newsweek, sources tell Variety. Given...

    InterActiveCorp (IACI -2.5%) is trying to find a buyer for Newsweek, sources tell Variety. Given Barry Diller declared IAC's investment in Newsweek "a mistake" last month, the report isn't surprising. The big question is whether anyone will be interested in assuming the declining magazine's huge liabilities even if it's given away for free. Variety's sources claim Newsweek's subscriber base fell to just 470K in Q1, down from the 1.5M claimed before the magazine went digital-only in late 2012. IAC's Media unit, which includes its Newsweek Daily Beast JV, reported an $8.8M loss for Q1.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:02 AM | 1 Comment
  • ALT

    Investors who took a "glass is half full" approach regarding shares of both PharmAthene (PIP...

    Investors who took a "glass is half full" approach regarding shares of both PharmAthene (PIP -11.3%) and SIGA Technologies (SIGA -0.3%) Tuesday after each company essentially claimed it came out ahead in a recent court ruling, are changing course today, as both companies trade lower, with PIP off double-digits. See SA contributor G. Hudon's recent article (and comments section) for more.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:59 AM
  • UNFI

    Investors may want to consider playing shares of United Natural Foods (UNFI -3.5%) for a modest...

    Investors may want to consider playing shares of United Natural Foods (UNFI -3.5%) for a modest bounce after today's post-earnings sell-off as Goldman raises its price target to $55 from $51, noting that FQ3 sales growth was "better than expected" while management upped its FY13 sales outlook even as it lowered the top end of its FY13 EPS guidance range. GS also reiterates a Neutral rating on the shares. (earnings PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:45 AM
  • CORV

    Cardiome Pharma (CRME +1%) adopts a change to its nomination procedures to limit board...

    Cardiome Pharma (CRME +1%) adopts a change to its nomination procedures to limit board nominations to a pre-annual meeting period. The change will require director candidates to be presented to the company during a 30-day period ending 30 days before the annual meeting date. Candidate nominations no longer will be allowed from the floor. The advance-notice proposal is set to go to shareholders for a vote during its annual meeting on June 28.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:14 AM
  • NFLX

    Shares of Netflix (NFLX +2.9%) take back some ground lost yesterday amid subpar reviews for...

    Shares of Netflix (NFLX +2.9%) take back some ground lost yesterday amid subpar reviews for Arrested Development. It could be an eventful morning with CEO Reed Hastings holding court at D11 and scheduled for a CNBC interview.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:08 AM
  • CIM

    The selling continues in the mortgage REIT space (MORT -3.4%), with one of today's biggest...

    The selling continues in the mortgage REIT space (MORT -3.4%), with one of today's biggest losers Chimera Investment (CIM -3.8%) a curious one as its exposure is credit risk not rate risk. Other tumblers: Armour (ARR -6.4%), New York Mortgage (NYMT -6.5%), Javelin (JMI -6.1%), MFA Financial (MFA -3.4%). There's little bid for American Capital - (AGNC -4.1%), (MTGE -3.3%) - with one trader noting Gary Kain's focus on owning pre-pay protected paper is another bet not paying off as rates rise.
